author: gagan-bhullar-tech
message:
fix(curriculum): cat photo app step 26 to 30 (#56338)

Co-authored-by: Anna <a.rcottrill521@gmail.com>

files.patch:
@@ -16,20 +16,21 @@ After the `figure` element, add another `h3` element with the text:
 There should be an `h3` element right above the second `section` element's closing tag. Make sure it has an opening and closing tag.
 
 ```js
-assert(
-  document.querySelectorAll('main > section')[1].lastElementChild.nodeName ===
-    'H3' && code.match(/<\/h3\>/g).length === 2
+assert.equal(
+  document.querySelectorAll('main > section')[1].lastElementChild.nodeName,
+    'H3'
 );
+assert.lengthOf(code.match(/<\/h3\>/g),  2);
 ```
 
 The new `h3` element should have the text `Top 3 things cats hate:`. Make sure to include the colon at the end of the text.
 
 ```js
-assert(
+assert.equal(
   document
     .querySelectorAll('main > section')[1]
     .lastElementChild.innerText.toLowerCase()
-    .replace(/\s+/g, ' ') === 'top 3 things cats hate:'
+    .replace(/\s+/g, ' '), 'top 3 things cats hate:'
 );
 ```
 
@@ -38,10 +39,8 @@ There should be a `figure` above the new `h3` element. You may have accidentally
 ```js
 const secondSectionLastElemNode = document.querySelectorAll('main > section')[1]
   .lastElementChild;
-assert(
-  secondSectionLastElemNode.nodeName === 'H3' &&
-    secondSectionLastElemNode.previousElementSibling.nodeName === 'FIGURE'
-);
+assert.equal(secondSectionLastElemNode.nodeName, 'H3');
+assert.equal(secondSectionLastElemNode.previousElementSibling.nodeName, 'FIGURE');
 ```
 
 # --seed--
